definition: respondent (in a survey, questionnaire, study etc)

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Respondents said they watch "very little" TV.
sentences.chinese: 被访者说他们“很少”看电视。

sentences.english: Chinese respondents widely believe that relations between the two countries have improved.
sentences.chinese: 中国被访者普遍认为两国关系有所发展。

sentences.english: Real Time information, mentioned by 48% of the respondents.
Thirty-nine percent of respondents believe the smart grid will diminish their privacy.
sentences.chinese: 39%的被访者认为智能电网会降低他们的隐私。

sentences.english: Large majorities in Europe and the U.S. have a negative view about China’s growing military prowess.
sentences.chinese: 绝大多数欧美被访者对中国军事实力增长持负面态度。

sentences.english: The names of those interviewed have been changed to protect their identities.
sentences.chinese: 不过被访者的姓名已经做了改动以策安全。

definition: participant in a survey/an interviewee/those questioned
investigation/inquiry/to investigate/to survey/survey/(opinion) poll/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
